version.description: KRB_STRING:The version of this device class

connection.description: KRB_STRING:The connection to the communication layer of the distributed system

serializationType.description: KRB_STRING:Decides whether the serialization type for objects will be binary or text

destinationName.description: KRB_STRING:The name of the physical destination (topic.queue) on the broker

messagingDomain.description: KRB_STRING:Messaging domain, i.e. point-to-point (JMS-Queue) or publish-subscribe (JMS-Topic)

protocol.description: KRB_STRING:Underlying transport protocol for jms based messages

ping.description: KRB_STRING:Client ping interval to test whether the connection to the broker is still alive [seconds]

trustBroker.description: KRB_STRING:Should the broker certificate be trusted?

acknowledgeSent.description: KRB_STRING:Should senders be blocked until the broker acknowledges message receipt?

deliveryInhibition.description: KRB_STRING:If true, messages delivered to the broker on the same topic and connection will not be consumed.

acknowledgeTimeout.description: KRB_STRING:Maximum waiting time for any broker acknowledge

messageTimeToLive.description: KRB_STRING:Time to live for an individual message send by a producer (0 = unlimited) [ms]

visibility.description: KRB_STRING:Configures who is allowed to see this device at all

classId.description: KRB_STRING:The (factory)-name of the class of this device

serverId.description: KRB_STRING:The device-server on which this device is running on

deviceId.description: KRB_STRING:The device instance ID uniquely identifies a device instance in the distributed system

archive.description: KRB_STRING:Decides whether the properties of this device will be logged or not

progress.description: KRB_STRING:The progress of the current action

state.description: KRB_STRING:The current state the device is in

start.description: KRB_STRING:Instructs device to go to started state

connectedSignals.description: KRB_STRING:Signals already connected to this slot

stop.description: KRB_STRING:Instructs device to go to stopped state

connectedSignals.description: KRB_STRING:Signals already connected to this slot

reset.description: KRB_STRING:Resets the device in case of an error

connectedSignals.description: KRB_STRING:Signals already connected to this slot

reverseDirection.description: KRB_STRING:Reverses the direction of the conveyor band

velocity.description: KRB_STRING:The velocity the motor will move with

targetSpeed.description: KRB_STRING:Configures the speed of the conveyor belt

currentSpeed.description: KRB_STRING:Shows the current speed of the conveyor

targetState.description: KRB_STRING:The target state of this device class

enableAppendMode.description: KRB_STRING:NOTE: Has no effect on Output-Network. If set to true a different internal structure is used, which buffers consecutive calls to write(). The update() function must then be called to trigger final outputting of the accumulated sequence of data.

filename.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be written

writeMode.description: KRB_STRING:Defines the behaviour in case of already existent file

format.description: KRB_STRING:Select the format which should be used to interprete the data

enableAppendMode.description: KRB_STRING:If set to true a different internal structure is used, which buffers consecutive calls to write(). The update() function must be called to trigger final outputting of the accumulated sequence of data.

filename.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be written

writeMode.description: KRB_STRING:Defines the behaviour in case of already existent file

enableAppendMode.description: KRB_STRING:NOTE: Has no effect on Output-Network. If set to true a different internal structure is used, which buffers consecutive calls to write(). The update() function must then be called to trigger final outputting of the accumulated sequence of data.

distributionMode.description: KRB_STRING:Describes the policy of how to fan-out data to multiple (shared) input channels

noInputShared.description: KRB_STRING:What to do if currently no share-input channel is available for writing to

enableAppendMode.description: KRB_STRING:NOTE: Has no effect on Output-Network. If set to true a different internal structure is used, which buffers consecutive calls to write(). The update() function must then be called to trigger final outputting of the accumulated sequence of data.

filename.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be written

writeMode.description: KRB_STRING:Defines the behaviour in case of already existent file

format.description: KRB_STRING:Select the format which should be used to interprete the data

indentation.description: KRB_STRING:Set the indent characters for printing. Value -1: the most dense formatting without linebreaks. Value 0: no indentation, value 1/2/3: one/two/three space indentation. If not set, default is 2 spaces.

writeDataTypes.description: KRB_STRING:This flag controls whether to add data-type information to the generated XML string

readDataTypes.description: KRB_STRING:This flag controls whether to use any potentially existing data type information to do automatic casting into the described types

insertXmlNamespace.description: KRB_STRING:Flag toggling whether to insert or not an xmlns attribute

prefix.description: KRB_STRING:Prefix flagging auxiliary constructs needed for serialization

filenameIn.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be read

filenameOut.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be written

filename.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be read

format.description: KRB_STRING:Select the format which should be used to interprete the data

filename.description: KRB_STRING:Name of the file to be read

connectedOutputChannels.description: KRB_STRING:Defines the inter-device connectivity for p-2-p data transfer (use format: <instanceId>@<channelName>)

dataDistribution.description: KRB_STRING:The way data is fetched from the connected output channels (shared/copy)

onSlowness.description: KRB_STRING:Policy for what to do if this input is too slow for the fed data rate (only used in copy mode)

minData.description: KRB_STRING:The number of elements to be read before any computation is started (0 = all, -1 = none/any)

keepDataUntilNew.description: KRB_STRING:If true, keeps data until new data from an connected output is provided. If new data is available the previous chunk is automatically deleted and the new one is made available for reading

respondToEndOfStream.description: KRB_STRING:Determines whether this input should forward a end-of-stream event to its parent device.

format.description: KRB_STRING:Select the format which should be used to interprete the data
